decks.notes: This deck revolves around using Underworld Breach to combo off and win the game quickly. It includes various card draw spells and ways to recur key spells from the graveyard, along with countermagic to protect the combo. The deck also includes powerful instants and sorceries like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to generate card advantage and gain additional turns. The deck aims to efficiently dig through the library, assemble the combo pieces, and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Collector Ouphe and Leovold, while also pressuring them with efficient threats like Deathrite Shaman and Tarmogoyf. It also utilizes powerful draw spells and counterspells, along with versatile planeswalkers like Narset and Oko. The deck aims to control the game through disruption and card advantage, while also presenting a clock to close out games quickly. It has a solid mana base with a mix of fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all three colors.

The deck focuses on using artifacts and card draw to generate mana and draw cards until it can play Paradoxical Outcome, returning all the artifacts to hand and drawing a ton of cards to set up a game-winning combo. Key cards include Paradoxical Outcome, artifacts like Moxen and Mana Crypt for mana acceleration, and cards like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm for card draw and selection. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces while controlling the game with counterspells and disruptive cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Flusterstorm.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful instants and sorceries to control the game while applying pressure with efficient creatures. By combining countermagic and removal spells with card advantage engines like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Dack Fayden, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and disrupt their game plan. With a streamlined mana base and access to powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, the deck can quickly gain tempo and overwhelm the opponent. The versatile and adaptable nature of the Jeskai Xerox archetype allows for flexibility in adapting to different matchups and strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to combine aggressive strategies with card advantage and disruption. By utilizing powerful cards like Dreadhorde Arcanist, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Dack Fayden, the deck aims to apply pressure while also controlling the opponent's plays. Cards like Force of Will, Flusterstorm, and Red Elemental Blast provide disruption against opposing spells, while cantrips like Preordain and Ponder help with card selection and digging for answers. Additionally, powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise allow the deck to refill its hand and maintain tempo advantage over the opponent.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo deck focuses on quickly assembling the Thassa's Oracle win condition by utilizing card draw and manipulation spells like Preordain, Brainstorm, and Demonic Tutor. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Misdirection to protect the combo, as well as control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Arcum's Astrolabe to manipulate the game state. The inclusion of a diverse range of powerful cards like Black Lotus, Ancestral Recall, and Time Walk allows for explosive plays and efficient resource management to achieve victory in a fast-paced format.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Aggro - Bazaar Aggro deck focuses on utilizing Bazaar of Baghdad to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures like Bloodghast, Hollow One, and Prized Amalgam. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, using cards like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap to protect its key creatures. Additionally, it includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Contagion to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to quickly fill up the graveyard and generate powerful board presence early on.

The deck focuses on generating a high amount of mana and card advantage through the use of fast mana sources like Moxen and Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and replay them for massive advantage. It also includes powerful spells like Tinker and Yawgmoth's Will to tutor for win conditions or recur resources from the graveyard. The deck aims to quickly assemble a winning combo or overwhelming board state to outpace the opponent and secure victory in a short amount of time.

The main concept of this Vintage 1 vs 1 deck is to aggressively fill the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Hogaak, and Vengevine, using cards like Basking Rootwalla and Hollow One to quickly deploy threats onto the battlefield. By utilizing cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Leyline of the Void to manipulate the graveyard, as well as utilizing cards like Force of Vigor to disrupt opponents, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of powerful creatures from the graveyard and hand while controlling the board with efficient removal spells.

The deck is focused on utilizing disruptive spells and powerful creatures to control the board and outpace the opponent. By using powerful planeswalkers like Narset and Oko, along with key disruptive creatures like Collector Ouphe and Leovold, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats of its own. The deck also includes card advantage spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise to maintain resources throughout the game. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and efficient threats, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's plays while ramping up your own aggressive creatures like Archon of Emeria and Tarmogoyf. It utilizes cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to control the opponent's hand and mana production. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns for additional disruption. With a mix of efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and counterspells like Force of Will, the deck aims to control the game's tempo while applying pressure with its creatures.

The deck focuses on using artifacts to control and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It utilizes cards like Crucible of Worlds, Sphere of Resistance, Sorcerous Spyglass, and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down the opponent's plays. Golos, Tireless Pilgrim helps find key cards while Karn, the Great Creator shuts down opposing artifacts. The deck also uses a variety of mana rocks and lands to generate mana quickly and efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources and win the game through attrition.

This deck utilizes the powerful combo potential of Underworld Breach to quickly and efficiently cast spells from the graveyard. By leveraging cards like Brain Freeze and Demonic Tutor, as well as powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of spells while using disruptive cards like Force of Will and Pyroblast to protect its game plan. With access to key mana acceleration in the form of the Moxen and the ability to recur important spells with Underworld Breach, this deck is built to execute its combo strategy with precision and speed.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Aggro-BUG Midrange deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies while deploying efficient threats. The deck runs disruptive cards like Collector Ouphe and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to control the board, alongside powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf. The deck also utilizes powerful card draw with spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise, as well as efficient removal with Abrupt Decay and Assassin's Trophy. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game while applying pressure to the opponent, ultimately taking over the game with its versatile card pool and efficient threats.

The main concept of this deck is to establish early pressure on the opponent using aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and True-Name Nemesis, while disrupting their strategy with cards like Collector Ouphe and Force of Will. The deck also includes powerful cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to control the board. Additionally, the deck has a strong card selection and manipulation package with cards like Brainstorm and Demonic Tutor, allowing the player to find their key cards efficiently. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on efficiently controlling the game through a combination of counter spells and disruptive creatures while also leveraging card advantage and selection to outmaneuver the opponent's strategy. By efficiently using cantrips and powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, the deck aims to maintain tempo and card advantage while applying pressure with efficient threats like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Monastery Mentor. The main goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while advancing its own strategy to secure a victory through a combination of aggression and control.
